alert.note: Alert for Spartanburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 15 at 12:45PM EST until December 21 at 5:01AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive runoff is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Spartanburg County in upstate South Carolina. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EST. * IMPACTS...River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1242 PM EST, High levels of runoff from this morning`s heavy rain will keep river and stream levels elevated this afternoon. Flooding of low-lying areas along Lawsons Fork Creek is expected from US 221 to Goldmine Rd. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Spartanburg. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
